intro: Cyclotrichium straussii, commonly known as the Strauss's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a circular pattern. Cyclotrichium straussii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
